AITrafficLab.schedule module

class AITrafficLab.schedule.GraphOrderedScheduler(model, node_classes, edge_classes)[source]

Bases: BaseScheduler

add(agent)[source]

Add an Agent object to the schedule.

Parameters:

  • agent – An Agent to be added to the schedule. NOTE: The agent must

  • method. (have a step())

get_agent_count(type=None)[source]

Returns the current number of agents in the queue.

remove(agent)[source]

Remove all instances of a given agent from the schedule.

Note

It is only necessary to explicitly remove agents from the schedule if the agent is not removed from the model.

Parameters:

agent – An agent object.

sort_agents(type, order, reverse=False)[source]
step()[source]

Execute the step of all the agents, one at a time.

AITrafficLab.traffic_model module

class AITrafficLab.traffic_model.Traffic_model(*args: Any, **kwargs: Any)[source]

Bases: Model

Multiagent model for traffic simulations in urban networks.

Variables:

  • connection (AITrafficLab.connection.Simulator_connection) – Traffic simulator abstraction.

  • graph (Networkx.DiGraph) – Graph associated to the urban network. Contains basic info such as travelling time, road length or road max speed.

  • line_graph (Networkx.DiGraph) – Line graph obtained from graph. It models the actual space where agents interact.

  • junctions (dict[id, AITrafficLab.agents.Junction_agent]) – Collection of all junction agents present in the model.

  • roads (dict[id, AITrafficLab.agents.Road_agent]) – Collection of all road agents present in the model.

  • schedule (AITrafficLab.schedule.GraphOrderedActivation) – Activation order for the different agents. Also stores all the agent instances.

  • to_destroy (list[AITrafficLab.agents.Vehicle_agent]) – Collection of all agents to be removed from the simulation in the next iteration.

  • road_statistics (dict[str, dict[AITrafficLab.agents.Road_agent,list[Object]]]) – Information logged by the road agents. If set to, every road agent logs a value each iteration. Information is stored first by the metric name (e.g. “time”, “co2”), and then by the agents itself. Each agent can store any kind of object each iteration on its own list. After the end of the simulation, this attribute can be casted into a Pandas DataFrame.

  • vehicle_statistics (dict[str, dict[AITrafficLab.agents.Vehicle_agent,list[Object]]]) – Information logged by the vehicle agents. If set to, every vehicle agent logs a value each iteration. Information is stored first by the metric name (e.g. “time”, “co2”), and then by the agents itself. Each agent can store any kind of object each iteration on its own list. After the end of the simulation, this attribute can be casted into a Pandas DataFrame.

__init__(graph_file, connection, node_generator=None, edge_generator=None, vehicle_generator=None, iters=None, gui=False, graph=None)[source]

Creates a Traffic_model instance.

Parameters:

  • graph_file (str) – File where the simulation’s graph info is stored.

  • connection (AITrafficLab.connection.Simulator_connection) – Traffic simulator abstraction.

  • node_generator (AITrafficLab.generators.Node_generator) – Factory object in charge of creating node instances out of network junctions. If no node_generator is provided a basic AITrafficLab.generators.Node_generator is created.

  • edge_generator (AITrafficLab.generators.Edge_generator) – Factory object in charge of creating edge instances out of network roads. If no edge_generator is provided a basic AITrafficLab.generators.Edge_generator is created.

  • vehicle_generator (AITrafficLab.generators.Vehicle_generator) – Factory object in charge of creating vehicle instances. If no vehicle_generator is provided a basic AITrafficLab.generators.Dumb_vehicle_generator is created.

  • iters (int) – Number of iterations to run the simulation before closing the connection. If no value is provided the simulation will keep on running forever or until there are no more vehicles left.

  • gui (boolean) – Indicates wether to launch or not the simulators Graffic User Interface.

  • graph (Networkx.DiGraph) – Custom graph to be used. If no graph is provided, the network topology is infered from the network in graph_file.

_destroy()[source]

Deletes the remaining agents.

_initialize()[source]
Sets up the conditions needed for the simulation to run:

-Starts the simulator’s connection -Reads the information from the graph_file. -Creates all the node and edge agents -Closes the connection to avoid resource waste until simulation is started.

_purge()[source]

Calls the on_destroy method for each agent stored in to_destroy and then removes it completely from the simulation.

_start_eternal()[source]

Runs the simulation until it finishes.

_start_iters()[source]

Runs the simulation for a set amount of iterations. Tracks the progress of the simulation.

add_agent(agent, place=None)[source]

Adds an agent to the model. If the agent is a vehicle it’s added to the traffic simulator too.

Parameters:

  • agent (Mesa.Agent) – Agent to be added

  • place (tuple[int,int]) – Road’s id where to place the agent if it’s a vehicle.

reset()[source]

Clears the information logged by the agents. May be used to run several simulation by restarting the model every time.

start()[source]

Starts the traffic simulation. Adds at least one vehicle agent, then creates an initial vehicle batch. The simulation will either run forever or for a set number of iterations depending on the value of the attribute iters.

step()[source]
Executes one iteration by running the logic of the model:

  • Creates new agents each iteration

  • Awakes the agents acording to the schedule’s logic

  • Runs one step simulation on the traffic simulator
